In 3.2, the collapsed section was automatically expanded as soon as the linked identifier was changed.

Fixed > 20060914

In auto-expand mode, ProjectionDocument.adaptProjectionToMasterChange(DocumentEvent) will try to modify the projection even if the master event does not overlap with the currently projected image. This should not be done when the master event does not remove any characters (lenght == 0), as this case will be ignored by ProjectionDocument.internalAddMasterDocumentRange() and thus cause a never ending loop.

In addition, setting the auto-expand mode in TextViewer.handleVerifyEvent(VerifyEvent) does not make sense: it tries to protect against document command modifications that contain various changes throughout the document. Because remote (not at the caret location) changes are often performed directly on the document, this protection can only be partial - in fact, much of the API in DocumentCommand is not used any longer in the SDK and should probably be revisited / deprecated. I filed bug 157285 to track this. I have removed the auto-expand code in TextViewer. The problem for which it was introduced (bug 29625) still works, as the use of distributed changes in a single document command has been abandoned.
